Unforetunately I did not get to attempt to cross them. After my demonstrati=
on, another group that was also there started complaining that the box made=
 too much noise and was hendering their investigation so I turned it off. I=
 wouldn't want my direct=A0communication with the deceased inmates to mess =
up their EVP work, now would I? I apoligized and put it away for the rest o=
f the night.
=A0According to the prison staff, the inmates firmly believed =
that if they died in prison their souls would be forever=A0trapped there. T=
his belief was so strong that the prison officials would take the elderly i=
nmates who were dying of natural causes to=A0a=A0local hospital so they wou=
ld'nt have to die in the prison. Maybe their beliefs were well founded. =A0=
=A0=A0

This is a wonderful recording, were you =
able to free any of them?=A0 So sad to see them still there behind bars, mu=
st be very lonely for them, they should be moving on so, they can start to =
work on making up for things on the other side.=A0 You folks should go up t=
here again, and hold a small prayer vigil for them, of course they would no=
 longer be ghosts trapped there, but there are plenty more around. sf

In a=
 message dated 5/27/2009 12:10:56 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time, foreverhaunte=
d57@ yahoo.com writes:



I was invited to spend the night in the West Virg=
inia Penitentiary this past weekend. I was asked to give a short demonstrat=
ion with my Optimus 12-797 hacked radio. Deep inside the prison surrounded =
by concrete and steel, the radio could not pick up any radio stations in ma=
nual mode. I wasn't sure how this might effect the demonstration. I was ple=
asantly suprised with the results. I recorded the session and the results c=
an be heard at this link. http://www.youtube. com/watch? v=3DKwDYu4RULlk
